SOPHOMORES VICTORS
IN INTERCLASS MEET

WOMEN'S CLUB TO GIVE
TEA ON WEDNESDAY
The Johns Hopkins Wo75
men's Club will hold a tea on
next Wednesday afternoon at
four o'clock in their rooms on
the third floor of Gilman Hall.
Both students and faculty are
invited to attend.
-711his is the second large
social function the Women's
Club has given in the last
month, a bridge party having
been given previously.

CAMPUS RESUMES CUSTOMARY
QUIET AFTER BANQUET SCRAPS

A. A. CARDS MUST
BE RESTAMPED
Mr. Henry Iddins, Business
Manager of the Athletic Association, requested on Saturday that all men in the University should take their A. A.
cards to the postoffice,and have
additional numbers placed on
them.
When these cards were
printed in the fall, no allowance was made for basketball
games, consequently a lack of
numbers has resulted. All men
are asked to attend to this
matter immediately.

WOMEN'S CLUB TO GIVE
TEA ON WEDNESDAY
The Johns Hopkins Wo75
men's Club will hold a tea on
next Wednesday afternoon at
four o'clock in their rooms on
the third floor of Gilman Hall.
Both students and faculty are
invited to attend.
-711his is the second large
social function the Women's
Club has given in the last
month, a bridge party having
been given previously.

"Ben"• Hey Everybody, have you read Smulovitch's article'

Then the lights went out—Dowell screamed—and two guns
blazed in the dark,
Then the lights went up—nothing happened—two men lay stiff
and stark.
Pitched on his head and pumped full of lead, lay dangerous
"Ben" McGrew,
And watching his luck, was his light of love—M. J. Smulovitch.
